item.title: Possible trip hazard - broken wires extended from tarmac, 23rd November
item.description:
Please could these raised cut wires be removed, they are on the route to/from the bus stop called Morgan Road stop. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Morgan Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heavy leaf fall and litter at Bus Stop B Plaistow Lane, 23rd November
item.description:
The leaf pile is thick on this narrow pavement by Bus stop B, Sundridge Park Station. Please could this and the litter be cleared. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the little on coffee shop on regents park road, 23rd November
item.description:
There has been a cobblestone poking out for years, I've often tripped on it and witnessed many passers by tripping over. I work in Cowshed which is next door for over 3 years, and the stone has been like this for as long as I can remember. Today I fell over, tripping over the stone causing me to scrape my knee and hit my shoulder on one of the scaffolding poles around the building.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 196, Regent's Park Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insane signage, 23rd November
item.description:
Hornsey rd appears to have recently been converted to 20 mph. So there are new lozenges all along the road going south east every 100 metres. Except for one lozenge which says 30! This is very very weird!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Hornsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A mattress has been dumped by the rubbish area, 23rd November
item.description:
Person was seen dumping the mattress in the rubbish area in front of 5 Havil Street on Saturday 22nd Nov just after 8.15pm. The individual does not reside in above block of flats and was seen dragging the mattress across on the property's CCTV recordings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havil Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
